Description: Colourless blown glass beaker with cut figured decoration. The principal scene shows a man carving the Greek letter zeta representing the number 7 on a Nilometer, a round-topped column on which was recorded the year's flood of the Nile. On the other side a woman (possibly Isis) reclines before a temple.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (pl.111)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1987 25 Apr-19 Oct, USA, Corning, Corning Museum of Glass, Glass of the Caesars 1987 18 Nov-1988 15 Mar, London, British Museum, Glass of the Caesars 1988 15 Apr-26 Jul, Germany, Cologne, Römisch-Germanisches Museum, Glass of the Caesars 1988 30 Sep-1989 6 Jan, Italy, Rome, Museo Capitolino, Glass of the Caesars
